admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
trustfund:
TF020000-NATIONAL HEALTH DEVELOPMENT,TF036602-LAO PDR - THE NAM THEUN SOCIAL
            AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECT,TF022742-PHRD-WOMEN'S HEALTH &
            SAFE MOTHERHOOD

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey satisfactory
            outcomes, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. Experience from the
            project reaffirms three critical lessons learned: the need
            to improve project readiness prior to loan effectiveness;
            the importance of adequate implementation capacity and
            management oversight, within the implementing agency; and,
            the need to clarify respective responsibilities of national,
            and local governments, early during preparation,
            particularly upon implementation of a project within a
            health system that has been decentralized. Other lessons for
            attention include the recognition that policy frameworks on
            women's health and safe motherhood, and programs,
            require careful technical preparation, and designs sensitive
            to the local context; the need for an integrated planning,
            financing, and management for services delivery related to
            women's health; intensified interventions in family
            planning based on information, education, and communication
            support; intensified interventions in reproductive tract
            infections, and sexually transmitted infections (STI), given
            the potential link between STI and HIV infection; and, a
            comprehensive review of training programs in women's health.
